content.description:
Start up on a bit-less-than-vertical rock and good edges to the first bolt. Continue upward on large feet, good-but-occasionally slanting hands. Stemming helps.

A bulge at the top awaits with trickier hands and feet; after surmounting the bulge make a move or two to the chains.
content.protection:
4 bolts, chain anchors. Anchor is shared with

Serpentine

(immediately right) and

Topaz

.
content.location: The third line from the left (uphill) side of the wall. A striking blue streak with a large pocket appears a bit downslope from the uphill end of the wall; this line is immediately left of the line that passes the large pocket.

content.description: First route right of the upper end chock-stone filled gully at the top of the 1 star wall. FA unknown, grade and difficulty unknown. Reason for bolting unknown ...4 bolts.

Head up along the right side of a large flake through three bolts, then trend left. Travel bit of easier ground for a moment, then a slightly steeper bit awaits.

Surmount this by finding small feet, and good, albeit slightly-less-than fully positive hands, and then head left to the anchors.

A few of the holds near the second bolt may be wet early in the season.
content.protection:
5 bolts, chain anchors. Last three bolts and anchor is shared with

Serpentine

(immediately left), and anchor is shared with

Voltaire

(left of

Serpentine

).
content.location: Near the left (uphill) side of the wall is a striking blue streak with a large pocket about ten feet up. This line is the right bolted route with its starting bolts on the right side of a large flake.

content.description: Crux at bulge, tricky finish.
content.location:
Right of Greyhounds & Brownies.

See West Wall Topo photo

content.description:
Large, comfortable pockets make the starting section a joy, but this is quickly followed by a somewhat blanker, perplexing section that requires trusting less-than-stellar feet and off-kilter handholds.

Continue up through a small bulge/roof. After the last bolt make a mildly unnerving rightward traverse to the chains.
content.protection:
6 bolts, chain anchors. Anchor is shared with

Afterglow

to the right.
content.location: Near the left (uphill) end of the wall is a large juniper tree and a small, constructed landing. This line is just downhill from the landing and travels through several obvious pockets for the first two bolts.

content.description: Very difficult climbing through out.
content.location:
Starts on the left side of the Maritime Buttress.

Left of Hook Direct.

See Topo photo.

content.description: Start left of the bolt line and climb just above the second bolt, then step across and use the large pocket for both feet. Clip the third bolt (glue-in) and face climb for two more bolts. Find jugs over the top to reach the chains.
content.protection:
5 bolts to chain anchors. Anchor is shared with

Voltaire

(left) and

Topaz

(right).
content.location: Follows the obvious  blue streak with a large pocket in the middle.

content.description:
Nice mellow climbing all the way up the nice black slab.

Easy way to get a rope on Hanky Head.
content.location:
Starts 20ft left of Hanky Head/Bermuda Shorts

See Topo Photo

content.description: Crux through roof.
content.location:
Starts 30ft uphill left of Remembrance Day.

Up some blocky rock to ledge.

content.description: Hard moves pulling left and over roof.
content.location:
Right of Laid back & Out of Sight.

See topo photo

content.description: Stick clipping the first bolt is a good idea considering the position, if you blow the first move you'll likely take you and your partner for a ride down the talus.  Easy climbing on perfect pockets for the first few bolts.  At some point, the pockets run out and you must crimp and side pull your way to the finish, using small feet and finding some good stems.  A worthy route, but perhaps not quite as good as some of the similar grades on the South Facing wall.  If located in another area at AF, it may deserve more stars!
content.location: As you head up the approach trail, look for the obvious white cave like area about 15 ft above the trail.   There are several route that start from this platform.  Maritime is the rightmost line.

content.description: Nice start, hard move into corner, pumpy to finish.
content.location:
Right of Tai chi

See topo photo

content.description: No info- five bolts. Shares the chains with Unknown Shitter 1. Second route downslope from the chokestone filled gully. "Might as well squeeze in this 5 bolt route while we're up here with a drill..."

An occasionally perplexing romp up a brown water streak, with a bit of I really don't feel like falling right here.

The available holds lead you to the right of the bolt line, leaving you to wonder if you're cheating or not (but if you went directly up the bolt line it'd be a bit contrived). Never-the-less, worth doing when you're here.
content.location:
Located to the right of

Crescendo

. Probably the easiest way to locate it is to consider the small clump of routes at the top of the slope (left-most), then note a bit of a gap, then find

Crescendo

. This line is then the next one to the right. This line also appears a bit smoother down low than the routes around it.

content.description: Easy slab leads to hard moves over the roof. Move left (Bermuda Shorts moves right here) up flake to pull a few more moves on to slab/finish
content.location:
The first routes you come to at the Hideaway West Wall.

See Topo Photo.

content.description: Crank start, tricky middle.
content.location:
Next route right of Afterglow

See Topo Photo.

content.description: Tricky start, nice pockets in the middle to the crux near top.
content.location:
Shares the same start as Maritime then moves left at the 2nd Bolt.

There is a direct start which is often wet called Hook Direct 12c

See Topo photo

content.description:
A few large pockets to start, then a fun couple of moves up a pillar like structure.

After the pillar some tougher moves await with less-than-totally positive handholds and small and/or sloping foot holds.

After the fifth bolt the angle eases a bit to the chains.
content.location: Just above a small, constructed terrace. This is the first route downhill after the small clump of routes at the top of the slope.

content.description: Nice climb up great pockets on black wall.
content.location:
From Bermuda Shorts/Hanky Head walk right and up to a ledge to start.

See Topo Photo.

content.description: Same start as Hanky Head pulling the hard roof, then some great moves up and right to finish.
content.location:
First route on Hideaway Lower West Wall.

See Topo Photo.

content.description:
Start on nice pockets that require a slight amount of sequential trickery to use in the least-strenuous manner. A "sporty runout" (Ruckmans' words) awaits between the second and third bolts (not the hardest bit of the route).

A technical section through a steep-ish bit with poor feet and less-than-fully-comforting handholds lurks above. Conquer this and then make a delicate move or two to the chains.
content.protection:
5 bolts, chain anchors. Anchor is shared with

Sundance

to the left.
content.location: Near the left (uphill) end of the wall is a large juniper tree and a small, constructed landing. This line is the second line downhill from the landing. There are several pockets leading to and past the first two bolts.
